SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing E-Commerce Parcels relative to Refrigerated Transport?
SRP.A: E-Commerce Parcels is {below} Refrigerated Transport in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total on-time delivery rate?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Same-Day Couriers}.

VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Automotive Parts}.

NC.Q: Between 1960 and 1961, did the total On-Time Delivery Rate experience a larger or smaller change than between 1958 and 1959?
NC.A: The change in total on-time delivery rate between 1960 and 1961 was {smaller} than between 1958 and 1959.

NC.Q: Between 1957 and 1961, was the average total On-Time Delivery Rate higher or lower than between 1960 and 1961?
NC.A: The average total on-time delivery rate between 1957 and 1961 was {higher} than between 1960 and 1961.

NC.Q: Between 1956 and 1960, did the total On-Time Delivery Rate experience a larger or smaller change than between 1958 and 1960?
NC.A: The change in total on-time delivery rate between 1956 and 1960 was {smaller} than between 1958 and 1960.

NC.Q: Was the total On-Time Delivery Rate in 1959 higher or lower than in 1961?
NC.A: The total on-time delivery rate in 1959 was {lower} than in 1961.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {Same-Day Couriers} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Automotive Parts, Oversized Loads, Pharmaceuticals, Same-Day Couriers, Refrigerated Transport, E-Commerce Parcels}.
